sense.name: changing one thing for another
sense.commentary: EXCHANGE[+event] The act of giving something in return for something received. The 'thing received' can be stated or implied.
sense.examples: There was an exchange of prisoners. Adam was promised immortality in exchange for his disobedience. Deductible losses on sales or exchanges of property are allowable. After a furious exchange of blows, both fighters collapsed to the mat. I exchanged all my Canadian dollars for Hong Kong dollars. There's an ion exchange in this reaction that produces hydrogen gas. The endgame began after an exchange of queens.

sense.name: a mutual expression of views
sense.commentary: EXCHANGE[+event] Usually refers to a discourse, usually an unpleasant one.
sense.examples: They had a bitter exchange. Our rare exchanges usually led to more arguments.

sense.name: marketplace
sense.commentary: Place where things are bought and sold. Usually refers to a stock exchange.
sense.examples: The New York Stock Exchange has been buzzing with activity. The floor of the exchange was a madhouse today.

sense.name: telecommunications facility
sense.commentary: Place where communications lines (usually phone lines) are connected.
sense.examples: Do you think the operators at the exchange are listening to your phone calls?

sense.name: changing money, collectively
sense.commentary: The act of changing money in a general sense. Individual transactions are not included here.
sense.examples: The rate of exchange is quite favorable right now. He earns his living from the exchange of currency.

sense.name: a rally
sense.commentary: A series of strokes. Probably only tennis or ping-pong.
sense.examples: After a short exchange, Connors won the point.
